intro: Corydalis uvaria, commonly known as the grape-root corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in spring. The plant has slender, creeping stems and produces small, oval-shaped leaves. Its root system is fibrous and often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. Corydalis uvaria thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas.
